sentence: 2.Mode requires at least a valid local position estimate (does not require a global position).
Flying vehicles can't switch to this mode without valid local position.
Flying vehicles will failsafe if they lose the position estimate.
4.Mode prevents arming (vehicle must be armed when switching to this mode).
5.Mode requires wind and flight time are within allowed limits (specified via parameters).
6.This mode is currently only supported on multicopter (or VTOL in MC mode).
7.The follow target must also be able to supply position information.
The vehicle will automatically yaw to face and follow the target from a specified relative angle, distance and height and altitude, depending on the altitude control mode.
By default it will follow from directly behind the target at a distance of 8 meters, and a height of 8 meters above the home (arming) position.
The copter will first ascend to minimum safety altitude of 1 meters above the ground or home, depending on the presence of a distance sensor.
It will ascend until it is 3 meters within the follow height to avoid potential collisions before moving horizontally.
Copter will always adjust it's heading to face the target
1.2D tracking (the default altitude mode) makes the drone follow at a height relative to the fixed home position (takeoff altitude).
2.2D + Terrain makes the drone follow at a fixed height relative to the terrain underneath it, using information from a distance sensor.
3.3D tracking mode makes the drone follow at a height relative to the follow target, as supplied by its GPS sensor.
